subject: Re: [junit] TestCase() is not public in junit.framework.TestCase
msgSnippet: Mark - I had this exact error when I first started working with Junit (last week). Someone in this group kindly pointed out that I had a malformed constructor
messageBody:
Mark - I had this exact error when I first started working with Junit (last week). Someone in this group kindly pointed out that I had a
malformed constructor for my test case class. My problem was that I wrote:

public class MyTestCaseClass extends TestCase {
private Itinerary i1;
public void MyTestCaseClass (String name)

--- I corrected it to be (w/o the "void")

public class RetrieveItineraryTest extends TestCase {
private Itinerary i1;
public RetrieveItineraryTest (String name)

It's worth double checking...

-Jeff

mark_farnsworth@... wrote:

> Can anyone tell me what is with this error? I'm an old C++ programmer
> but a newbie to jUnit and Java. My classpath appears to be correct.
> The complete error message reads:
> TestCase() is not public in junit.framework.TestCase; cannot be
> accessed from outside package
>
> Someone please help. I'm under the gun and losing it...
>
> Many thanks in advance,
> Mark
